subject: Art & Design
title: Alignment: Left, Right, Center, and Justified
description: A quick win: understand Alignment: Left, Right, Center, and Justified.

hook.text: Centered text on a wedding invitation looks elegant. Centered text in a long article looks amateurish.

buildup.text: Left-aligned (ragged right) is the default for Western body text. The uneven right edge aids reading flow.

discovery.text: Justified text (even on both sides) looks clean but creates uneven word spacing â€” 'rivers' of white space.

twist.text: Justified text only works well with hyphenation. Without it, spacing problems are unavoidable.

climax.text: Right-aligned text is rare in body copy but works for pull quotes, captions, and accents.

punchline.text: Left-align by default. Break the rule only with good reason.

quiz.question: What problem does justified text often create?
options: Uneven word spacing that creates 'rivers' of white space
Letters that are too small to read
